column4: does gutsy come with a firewall? if so, where do i go to configure it?
i was just asking if one came installed. that answered my question though. =)
just use transmission--no ports to open :}
guess what? still not going. =) could it be a package on my end that would mess up all of the bittorrent traffic?
just wait a bit, that kind of thing is hard to manage (kind of like herding cats)
the file im downloading has ~ 29,000 seeds. it has timed out 3 times...any ideas?
assuming this an ubuntu iso (heh), then it would be an issue with the seeders,and likely not your computer--you can also try utorrent with wine, or ktorrent
meaning ubuntu, obviously may need to read up on port forwarding and dht (teh google is yer friend) :}
outside of getting a linux magazine of downloading the various distros individually, then likely not
may i ask....since WHEN did they make a (LTS).1?
responding to the ssl problem amongst others
